3.74. 
Counterclaims 
1. The spouse against whom the application for legal separation has been lodged has the right to lodge a counterclaim for divorce. 
2. The spouse against whom the divorce proceedings have been instituted has the right to bring a counterclaim for legal separation. 
3. If one spouse seeks a divorce and the other spouse seeks a declaration of legal separation, the court may dissolve the marriage by declaring that it was dissolved through the fault of both or one of the spouses or by declaring the spouses to be legally separated.
